DIAGCAR ELECTRONICS is a dynamically developing company that was launched in 2002. We specialize in designing software for diagnosis and repair of various automobile electronic systems. title: For Sale:  Utah CFP Oregon CHL Concealed Carry Class  10/06/2014
postcontent:
Utah CFP Oregon CHL Concealed Carry Class

Monday October 6, 2014 7:00 PM

Honey Toast Cafe, 12520 SW Farmington Road, Beaverton, OR 97005

Class cost is $65. Save $5 by pre-registering online!

Pre-Register Online: http://www.keepcalmandcarry.net/utah-cfp-oregon-chl-concealed-carry-class-6-10-2014-Registration

This class covers everything you need to get your Oregon Concealed Handgun License and your Utah Concealed Firearms Permit. 

Our course exceeds all firearms safety training exceeds the requirements to obtain your Utah CFP, pursuant to Utah Code Title 53 Chapter 5 Section 704, and your Oregon CHL pursuant to ORS 166.291(f)(G). 

Our process starts with issuing you a packet of information, an application for your permit, and fingerprint cards that you will need. We will do your fingerprinting, take your passport photo and make copies of your driver's license before class starts. We do this so that upon completion of this class, you will have a complete packet which you can submit to Utah BCI (Bureau of Criminal Identification) with your payment. You will also have all the information you need to obtain your Oregon CHL from your local Sheriff's department. 

Subjects covered are: Basic Handgun Safety, Tactical Issues, Concealed Carry Firearm selection tips, Ammunition, Holsters, Gun Free Zones, Reciprocity, Cleaning, Storage, Firearm Transport, Justifiable Force, Criminal and Civil liability, How to interact with Law Enforcement, and how to apply for your Permit. 

After attending this class you will have a fundamental understanding about handgun safety and the rights and responsibilities and laws associated with the carrying of a concealed Handgun in multiple states. 

This is NOT a live firing class. Do NOT bring a firearm with you to the class. 

Even though the class time is only scheduled to be 2 1/2 hours long, there will be time for questions and answers after the class. 

More Information: http://www.keepcalmandcarry.net/utah-cfp-oregon-chl-concealed-carry-class-6-10-2014-Schedule 
 Download a Flyer: http://www.keepcalmandcarry.net/ClassFlyer/utah-cfp-oregon-chl-concealed-carry-class-10-6-2014.pdf 

If you are interested in just the Oregon Concealed Handgun License class visit http://www.keepcalmandcarry.net/oregon-concealed-handgun-license-class-Training_Class

I have for sale a Norinco Mak 90 underfolder with a real Norinco Bakelite magazine. This rifle is in great condition, very little wear in any of the bluing, and is a generally excellent example of a Chinese AKM. The handguards and PG are Bakelite and it has a slant brake installed. title: For Sale:  Smith and Wesson 325 TR Performance Center 45 ACP
location: Apex, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
I have a LNIB S&W Mod. 325 TR for sale. This is a special edition hand built .45 ACP revolver made as a collab with Clint Smith at the Thunder Ranch. It's an extremely well made gun, hand built by the Performance Center. Features a 4 inch shrouded barrel with a 1913 under rail for a light attachment, interchangable front sight blades (comes with a brass bead), scandium N frame, 6 shot cylinder with moonclip capability, Performance Center trigger with overtravel stock, all PC internal parts (made of bar stock steel with case bluing rather than standard S&W MIM parts) and all the original kit and kaboodle. The gun comes in a Eagle Industries soft case with the Thunder Ranch logo on it. I'll throw in a whole mess of Moonclips and a Wilson Combat De-Mooner. 

Why you need this gun... This gun is a reloader's dream, it can shoot everything from weak target loads to high pressure +Ps and do it with absolute reliability. Reloads are super easy, .45ACP's are so short and fat that they're easy to manipulate during reloads, much moreso than other cartridges like .357 when on Moonclips, so you can shoot this gun as fast as a semi-auto. The trigger combined with a fixed barrel makes it one of the most accurate pistols available, I've fired around 50 rounds thru the gun and it grouped better than my Nighthawk 1911. Couple all that stuff with the fact that this is a limited edition, hand built collectable S&W, and you're looking at a fantastic investment that's a joy to shoot and own. 

I'm asking 1200$ for the gun, that's what I paid for it.  NO TRADES.

title: For Sale:  Paying it forward: Just doing the right thing
postcontent:
Paying it forward: Just doing the right thing.

Just wanted to let everyone know that doing the right thing not only allows oneself to rest, but also give peace of mind that you as a human can make a difference in someones life.

At approximate mid afternoon time I had arrived at the range for a great afternoon of shooting not only my new old mosin but my ak that my son had bought me for my birthday. 
As always I say my hellos and afternoons to everyone on the line and start general chit chat and ask what kind of gear they had and sometimes asking the decision making process in acquiring the items. This helps me in learning about things that I do not normally see in a day to week environment that gives me ideas to either look into getting some of the same, or possibly just learning more about these items of interest.

Scenario: closing time sunday at the range.
Had a nice afternoon at the 600 range talking to a couple of guys to the left of me and a couple of guys to the right of me. The person directly left to me had many moments of wisdom and knowledge to share that not only enhanced my life and made a difference but gave me insight into the human nature as a whole on a world level. I had asked this particular person several questions and he promptly give me personal attention and details that give me knowledge that will be of use not only today but in the future. 
The afternoon began like many afternoons at the range and with the hot and cold moments we had time to come together the group of people at either one end or the other to discuss upcoming local events or more generally the gear they had brought with them, the gear they didnt bring with them, or maybe even the gear they were thinking about getting and the reasons why. It is always a learning experience for me when I go to the range. The atmosphere and and sense of belonging makes for a very satisfying and enjoyable time, day after day after week. Kind of like in the wizard of oz. There is no place like home on the range type of feel.

This day at the range began like so many others and this was no exception but with one very special twist of fate. 
I myself since I live farther out of town than most always makes the most of my two hour round trip and bring many items with me to do testing of gear with and to make youtube videos to share with people. The day was waning right about the six pm hour and I had been at the range a good four hours having an excellent day. What happened in the next half hour was life changing for me, and as well as day changing for the person(s)  

Everyone other than the two guys around me had left for the day and they were getting their targets retrieved. I was as well packing up to goto the pistol bay.
After going to the pistol bay for about a half hour I decided to go back to the 600 range and shoot a little .22 at the clays out at the fifty berm. The time was a little after six pm.
After setting up the clays and returning I noticed a dark range bag in length that was on the table. Since I was the last one to leave and the ro had already taken off and the other two guys were long gone i went over and got the bag. After looking around for a name on the outside I then looked insiode and noticed this partucular item was one that one of the other guys had shown me a couple hours earlier. But they were way down on the left. Why was this close to me i was wondering. Well as i remember the person was showing off their most recent build and wanted me to look at it and comment.  Since no body was around when I left the gear went with me.
The next day i contacted the range. A little after lunch the owner of the stuff called me and we made an meeting to return the gear.
I made the half hour drive back to omaha monday night and delivered the gear to its owner. 
All told without going into too much detail there was a complete ar15 with dot, and another upper with a scope. Also included in the bag was ammo and a axe.
Estimated value of all the gear after I identified the individual components was around three thousand dollars.
So in less than 24 hours this person not only had his gear back, but a large part of his life and his arsenal family back and comfortable.

I am glad I could make in difference in your life today.
End of story...
Thank you.

title: For Sale:  HK P30 .40CAL
postcontent:
HK P30
Description:
P30
A recent HK pistol design, the P30 is a modern police and security pistol that combines function and safety. Ergonomic features include a special grip frame with interchangeable backstrap inserts and lateral plates, allowing the pistol to be individually adapted to any user. Ambidextrous controls include dual slide releases and magazine release levers.
Variants with a conventional double-action/single action trigger have a serrated decocking button located on the rear of the frame. Variants with HK’s enhanced double action only Law Enforcement Modification* (LEM) trigger have no external decocking controls.
The HK Law Enforcement Modification (LEM) trigger system combines the advantages of a cocked striker component (constant level of trigger pull from first to last round fired) with a double-action hammer system. Using such an enhanced trigger system consolidates ease of use and safety into a convenient, innovative trigger operation—one that reduces the chance of unintended firing. And in case of an ammunition-related failure to fire, all that is needed is an additional second or third squeeze of the trigger without the need of first pulling the slide back to re-cock the pistol. The enhanced LEM trigger system combines the reliability of a double action revolver trigger with the crisp trigger of a single action pistol.
P30S models have an ambidextrous safety lever mounted on both sides of the frame. S models are available in conventional double-action/single action trigger mode and with HK’s enhanced double action only Law Enforcement Modification trigger
A Picatinny rail molded into the front of the frame makes mounting lights, laser aimers, or other accessories easy and convenient. The extractor doubles as a loaded chamber indicator providing a subtle tactile and visual reminder of a loaded chamber.
Extensively tested, the P30 has already been adopted by several European police agencies. Excellent weight and balance make the P30 naturally pointable, easy to control, and accurate to shoot. An open notch rear sight with luminous (non-radioactive) contrast points allows for fast and accurate target acquisition, even under poor lighting conditions.
During a recent (2009-2010) endurance test, a P30 test pistol fired more than 91,000 rounds without any major component failures.
P30 and P30S models available in 9 mm and .40 S&W.
Key Features:
Special grip frame with interchangeable backstrap inserts and lateral plates
MIL-STD-1913 (Picatinny) rail on frame for mounting lights and accessories
Corrosion proof fiber-reinforced polymer frame
Polygonal bore profile for increased velocity, easier cleaning, and longer barrel life
Multiple trigger firing modes available
Patented HK recoil reduction system
One piece machined slide made from nitro-carburized steel
Corrosion resistant “hostile environment” blued finish
Ambidextrous slide levers and
Ambidextrous magazine release magazine
Patented lock-out safety device
Bobbed hammer (LEM models)
Spurred hammer (DA/SA models)
Automatic hammer and firing pin safeties
Ambidextrous safety levers (P30S model)

title: For Sale:  HK USP 9
postcontent:
HK USP 9MM
Description:
USP
Originally designed for the American market, the USP (Universal Self-loading Pistol) has found international acceptance as an accurate and ultra-reliable handgun. Features favored by U.S. law enforcement and military users provided much of the design criteria for the USP. The controls are uniquely American, influenced by such famous designs as the Government Model 1911 pistol.
All USPs use a fiber-reinforced polymer frame stiffened by stainless steel inserts at areas subject to stress and friction. HK pioneered this use of polymer materials in the production of handguns more than 30 years ago with the development of the VP70Z and P9S pistols.
The USP control lever, a combination safety and decocking lever, is frame mounted and quickly accessible, unlike the slide-mounted safeties common on many semi-automatic pistols.
Using a modified Browning-type action with a special patented recoil reduction system, the USP recoil reduction system reduces recoil effects on pistol components and also lowers the recoil forces felt by the shooter. This same recoil reduction system has been tested and proven in the HK Mark 23 pistol developed for the U.S. Special Operations Command. The USP recoil reduction system is insensitive to ammunition types and requires no special adjustment or maintenance. It functions effectively in all USP models.
The modular design of the USP's internal components allows the control lever function to be switched from the left to the right side of the pistol for left-handed shooters. The USP can also be converted from one type of trigger firing mode to another. This includes combination double-action and single-action (DA/SA) modes and double action only (DAO) modes.

title: For Sale:  BERETTA 85F
postcontent:
Beretta 85-F is a very light weight, efficient and accurate hand gun that is great for carrying concealed. Beretta has some of the best quality hand guns on the market. Beretta discontinued importation of the 85-F to the United States in 2013.

chambered for the .380 ACP (9 mm Short) cartridge. The 85 have a single stacked magazine with eight round capacity, and resultant thinner grips. The 85 has a 3.81" The F versions of the 85 introduced the "combat" trigger guard with a squared-off front that allows for a finger hold, plastic grips, a proprietary "Bruniton" finish, a chrome-plated barrel and chamber, and a combination safety and decocker lever, which when operated in the middle position disconnects the trigger bar from the hammer, and in the upper position lowers the cocked hammer.  
 No Manual.  Just the box and two magazines.  I picked up the gun at the gun show in cape.  It's really tight, needs to have some ammo run through it to break it in.  My wife's hands aren't strong enough to cycle the side.  Wound up getting her a Beretta Nano. Must be a Missouri resident and have a valid ID.

postcontent:
Come on people! If you want to sell or trade your gun, that's fine. What makes you think you can get a gun, shoot it, carry it & use it, then post it on here as 'LNIB' for more than a new one or more than you paid for it??? Reality check...in case you haven't noticed, dealers sell guns on here too. On the same page, I see USED Glocks (just an example) listed for the same price as a BRAND NEW one or even more! What's going on here? I'd rather buy from a legit dealer, get a background check & wait a few days to pick up my purchase, than get ripped off buying a used gun for the same price. What happened to like minded people just sharing their hobby & passing on a good deal??? title: For Sale:  REMINGTON R-15 VTR PREDATOR CARBINE CS
postcontent:
REMINGTON R-15 VTR
Description:
 We created an unrivaled combination of precision accuracy, blazing-fast follow-ups and hunt-specific features. The new R-15 VTR™ modular repeating rifle was born of the most advanced design aspects of AR-15-style rifles available today with a strong emphasis on optimizing form and functionality for the modern predator aficionado. The results are astounding – with very serious implications for every coyote, fox or bobcat that crosses its path.

For peak accuracy, the R-15’s 0.680" OD barrel is precision-crafted from ChroMoly steel. It’s free-floated within the machined-aluminum fore-end tube and given a recessed hunting crown to ensure gasses escape evenly around the bullet for the ultimate in shot-to-shot consistency. Six longitudinal flutes forward of the gas block promote rapid barrel cooling and increase rigidity while reducing weight, further contributing to this rifle’s ability to print tiny clusters at an incredible pace.



And our new hunting single-stage trigger design is as cleanbreaking as they come. Whether you choose the 223 Remington or 204 Ruger version, the semi-automatic gas action all but eliminates muzzle jump and recoil so your target remains in the crosshairs. And when it’s time to add optics, the receiver-length Picatinny rail makes it a rock-solid cinch.



Control comes naturally with the ergonomic pistol grip and lightweight overall design of the R-15. Its uppers and lowers are machined from aluminum forgings for featherweight durability, and the fore-end tube is drilled and tapped for accessory rails. This new family of firearms consists of three models. Each was designed with input from leading predator authorities and decked in the ultra-effective Advantage® MAX-1 HD™ camouflage to blend with sage, open country and a multitude of hunting terrains. All come with five-round magazines and are compatible with all aftermarket AR-15 magazines and other accessories.



Our R-15 VTR Predator Carbine and R-15 Predator Carbine CS* (Collapsible Stock) handle like lightning with their 18" barrels and weigh a mere 6 3/4 lbs. – perfect for high-speed hunting scenarios. The Predator Carbine CS features a telescoping stock with a fully adjustable length of pull for a custom fit.



KEY FEATURES: New semi-automatic AR-15-style rifle developed with the predator hunter in mind Free-floating button-rifled 0.680" Muzzle OD ChroMoly barrels with recessed hunting crown for superior accuracy Fluted barrel design reduces weight and promotes rapid barrel cooling Clean-breaking single-stage hunting trigger Receiver-length Picatinny rail for adding optics Ergonomic pistol grip Fore-end tube drilled and tapped for accessory rails Full Advantage® MAX-1 HD™ coverage Includes 5-round magazine Legal for hunting in most states Compatible with aftermarket AR-15 magazines

title: For Sale:  New Century Arms SB47 Stabilizing Brace AK
postcontent: No Tax Stamp Required! Innovation & Added Functionality! The SB47 stabilizing brace is an awesome invention that secures AK style pistols to the forearm of the shooter and assists in firing the pistol the way it is intended - with one hand. Using the SB47 in this way, recoil is reduced significantly, resulting in more accurate shooting without compromising safety, comfort or control. Designed and made by a U.S. Military veteran with help from a top V.A. prosthetic specialist, the intent and design of the stabilizing brace is to help America's wounded veterans enjoy large frame handgun shooting again. The concept was to invent and create a device that would act as an extension of one's own arm - so it is like a part of your body. Well the SB47 did that - and more! Not only did it help our wounded heroes regain their confidence and handgun skills, it was wicked fun for anyone to use! BATF approved for everybody, the SB47 does not require any special permits, doctors notes or SBR tax stamp! Will fit PAP M92 PV, PAP M85 PV, Draco and C39 Pistols. Comes in retail ready packaging. Condition: New.

title: For Sale:  Llama .380 ACP 7 Shot Magazine Triple K SD CA Blue Steel for IIIA Pony type Pistols mfg 1950 – 1997 380 Automatic
postcontent:
Our # XM46M

NO New York City. This listing is for ONE Magazine; buyers, however, may take any number of extras we have on hand at the same per-mag price and with no additional shipping charges. Llama-Gabilondo was a very credible firearms manufacturer in Eibar, Spain, and produced excellent quality pistols for almost a century, ca. 1904 until 1997. Their model III and IIIA pistols scaled the basic 1911 pattern down to a neat little pistol chambered in .380 ACP that was roughly half the size of John M. Browning’s invention. Many specimens we’ve sold in our six decades of dealing guns had no importer stamps. Most specimens from the 1970s and 1980s bore Stoeger import stamps, and then the final ones from the 1990s imported by RSA of New Jersey. Since the company went belly up in 1997, there are no more magazines. Here, then, is the only game in town, the Triple K manufactured magazine for Llama model IIIA Pistols. Manufacturer is Triple K of California. Construction is all steel magazine body, floorplate, and cartridge follower, with steel spring. Each magazine holds 7 rounds of .380 ACP caliber ammunition. Pistol may be marked 9mm Corto. That is Italian for .380 ACP. This magazine will fit Llama model IIIA, and the identical Mugica Llama model 105-G, so long as they are chambered in .380 ACP caliber. It will not fit a model XA Llama that is chambered in .32 ACP caliber. It Will Not Fit a Colt Government .380. It Will Not Fit a Star .380. It Will Not Fit the valve of a 19th Century Italian Bidet. It will only fit Llama IIIA and Mugica 105-G pistols chambered in .380 ACP caliber. Measurements are 3 7/8 inches from the top body lips to the bottom of the floorplate. Body length is 1.095 inches back to front. Thickness is .431 inch. Magazine release slot measures 2 3/16 inches from the bottom of the slot to the top of the floorplate. carbinesforcollectors com llama page has an informative comparative history. Triple K magazine quality improved drastically with their move to U.S. production about 15 years ago. We’re offering the magazine in the photos, or one of its identical mates, for only $ 39.00. Not for sale to residents of New York City. Any magazine deliveries into New York City require written permission of the Police Commissioner, so we cannot ship magazines into any of the six boroughs or 176 some odd zip codes, per NYC Code 10-131.10. Civilian residents of New York State are legally enjoined from loading more than 7 rounds into any magazine.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  Grips, Magazines, slings, holsters, scopes, mounts, parts & most any small light items,  entire accessory orders only $10.00 total shipping no matter how many a person buys. $10.00 for an entire order, Not $10.00 per item or anything of the sort. $20 Flat Fee on magazine orders to Alaska, Hawaii, or Puerto Rico, and gun parts to PR civilians must ship to an FFL. Magazines and any small light non-gun items ride free with ammo orders. We accept checks with no more than 7 days hold. GA Pay, MC, Visa, Discover phone- or fax-in 7 3 1 9 8 9 4 7 2 3 orders, USPS Money Order items shipped ASAP please put your full information, venue number, and what the item is on any messages.
